column2: Five minutes ago it was three o'clock, Murphy said. "I can't be certain, but I theorize that it must now be about three-oh-five." I folded my arms. "I don't usually do stakeouts."
For one moment Ruth could see the bones of the bats standing out clearly, as if in an X-ray picture. Then all the green turned black. It was 3:05 P.M.

Ultimately, at five minutes past three that afternoon, Smith admitted the falsity of the Fort Scott tale. "That was only something Dick told his family. So he could stay out overnight. Do some drinking."
